title: What’s An Average Exoplanet? ESA’s Upcoming ARIEL Mission Should Provide Answers
description: ESA’s ARIEL mission will detect the chemical signatures of at least a thousand planetary atmospheres in hopes of providing theorists with a long sought ‘standard model’ of exoplanets.

title: Overwatch 2’s Thanksgiving Double Match XP Weekend Is Now Live
description: It's a good chance to crank through some Battle Pass levels to get that sick Cyber Demon Genji Mythic skin.

title: 20,000 Died Amid Punishing Heatwaves And Record Temperatures Across Western Europe This Summer, Data Indicates
description: This summer was Europe’s hottest on record and experts warn climate change will continue to drive temperatures upwards.

title: Elon Musk Says He’s Granting ‘Amnesty’ For Nearly All Banned Twitter Accounts
description: Just days after he reinstated former President Donald Trump, Musk said he would grant "amnesty" for suspended accounts that haven't broken the law or engaged in "egregious spam."

title: #MaskUp #BringBackMasks Trend As Covid-19, RSV, Flu Cases Increase
description: Health professionals, scientists, and others are asking why recommendations about Covid-19 and respiratory illness precautions have not been including face mask wearing.

title: This Is The Best Xbox Series X Black Friday Deal For 2022
description: Get the Xbox Series X and Xbox All Access for $150 less than usual.

title: Can ADHD Medications Increase The Risk Of Cardiovascular Disease?
description: Despite the fact that there is sufficient evidence that proves ADHD medications can help in reducing the neurodevelopmental condition’s core symptoms, researchers have raised concerns about both stimulants and nonstimulant medications’ cardiovascular safety.

title: The Booming European Climatetech Sector Brings Hope To A Continent Under Energy Seige
description: The European climatetech opportunity remains a cheerful outlier in an otherwise gloomy economic outlook – in just two years, investment has doubled and the ecosystem has grown by leaps and bounds.

title: A (Very) Short History Of Life On Earth By Henry Gee — Review
description: Humans and all other living beings that occupy the planet today are the products of 4.6 billion years of evolution on Earth

title: Fair And Sufficient – Keywords For Climate-Friendly Fashion Consumption
description: The single best way for people in rich countries to reduce the climate impacts of fashion is to buy fewer new clothes.

title: Twitter Reportedly Leaves Brussels—Europe’s Regulatory Hub—Amid Concerns About Musk’s Content Moderation Plans
description: Reports, including comments from Twitter’s former safety lead, suggest hateful speech and conduct on the platform spiked after Musk took over.

title: Apple Pencil For iPhone Scrapped At 11th Hour, Leak Claims
description: A new Apple Pencil was due to be announced in September, but was canceled at the last minute, according to a new rumor.

title: Why Winter Does Not Disprove Global Warming
description: Even with the climate warming crisis, there will always be winter, snowstorms, and the Polar Vortex. Here's why.

title: Riding With Royalty On Spectacular C-Suite Bicycling Break To Ibiza
description: LeBlanq's "joyrides" are upscale cycling holidays paired with fine dining—and you get to rides with Tour de France legends and world champions.

title: The FTC May Move To Block Microsoft’s Monster Activision Blizzard Acquisition
description: Just as Microsoft has been doing battle with UK and EU regulators over its Activision Blizzard Acquisition for months, a new final boss may be about to enter the arena.

title: ‘Warrior Nun’ Season 2 Has Netflix’s Highest Audience Scores Ever As Fans Demand Season 3 Renewal
description: Right now, Warrior Nun season 2 has a perfect 100% from critics, albeit that’s only six of them, but more impressively, a 99% audience score on Rotten Tomatoes based on 4,500 reviews at the time of this writing.

title: Pokemon Scarlet And Violet’s 10 Million Copies Sold In Three Days Breaks Every Nintendo Record
description: While Pokemon Scarlet and Violet are marred with technical problems and suffering from series-low critic and user review scores the games are…also absolute sales monsters, showing the series is stronger than it’s ever been before in terms of player interest.

title: Iranian Protesters Claim Regime Is Using ‘Nerve Agents’ To Quell Riots
description: Some 40 people have been killed in protests in Iran the last week alone. Now protesters say the regime is using nerve agents against them — but what is the evidence? Chemical weapons expert Dan Kaszeta says there is none, and that the claims have negative consequences.

title: A Thanksgiving Day Memo To Florida Governor Ron DeSantis
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has recently enacted legislation to eliminate ESG in Florida's state pension funds. Yet the University of Florida Investment Corporation considers ESG factors to be important from an investment risk perspective. What should Mr. DeSantis do about this apostasy?

title: Google Stadia Refund Blunder Gives Gamers An Unexpected Windfall
description: Mistake sees lucky Google Stadia customers get hundreds of dollars' worth of unexpected refunds

title: 3 Reasons Early Stage Founders Should Ignore The Doom Mongers
description: It seems there is a competition playing out online to hand out the most pessimistic advice possible to founders. Such blatant doom-mongering might be good for views and likes, but it is nonsense.

title: Today’s ‘Heardle’ Answer And Clues For Thursday, November 24
description: Here's today's 'Heardle' song, along with some hints.

title: Today’s ‘Quordle’ Answers And Clues For Thursday, November 24
description: Some hints and the solution for today's 'Quordle' are just ahead.

title: ‘Pokémon Scarlet And Violet’ Have Sold More Than 10 Million Copies In Their First Three Days
description: It seems that 'Pokémon Scarlet' and 'Violet' have sold incredibly well, amassing more than 10 million sales in their first three days and breaking records in the process.

title: Today’s Wordle #523 Hints, Clues And Answer For Thursday, November 24th
description: How to solve today's Wordle.

title: Is This Samsung’s Next-Generation  Smartphone Camera Sensor?
description: Samsung has registered a new trademark covering what appears to be a next-gen camera image sensor.

title: Microsoft’s Activision Blizzard Deal ‘Likely’ Faces A Lawsuit From The Feds To Try And Block It
description: The Federal Trade Commission is "likely" to try and block Microsoft's attempt to buy Activision Blizzard for $68.7 billion. But there's no guarantee yet that the agency will file an antitrust lawsuit.

title: What Are Those Two Bright ‘Stars’ Suddenly Shining In The East After Dark?
description: As soon as the Sun goes down one really bright star is visible high in the eastern night sky. About an hour later another bright star begins to shine closer to the horizon. What’s going on?
